terminologie_extrait.contexte: three places you want to place your shots - wide forehand, wide backhand, and the opponent's middle
three places you want to place your shots - wide forehand, wide backhand, and the opponent's middle
the opponent's middle is a moving target; it becomes natural to find this moving target the more you play an opponent's middle

hitting-accurate-shots.diagnostic: Players are often amazed at how accurate a top player can place his shots.

debutant.nom: practice relentlessly, aiming for the three spots

intermediaire.nom: memorize the feel of holding the racket in each position
learn to time the backswing so that the racket aims where you want it to go far enough before contact

avance.nom: develop a feel for changing the direction of the racket at the last second to throw opponents off

exercices_complementaires.description: aim the racket crosscourt, wide to the opponent's backhand, and keep holding it out there until you have memorized the feel of holding the racket in this position
aim the racket down the line, and memorize the feel of holding the racket in this position

metriques_progression.description: practice relentlessly, aiming for the three spots

erreurs_a_eviter.description: give your opponent a much easier shot, where he doesn't even have to move much
